senses.de: To bring back to the original condition
senses.ex: The museum restored the ancient statue.

Tips.title: Physical Objects
Tips.description: Usually involves material things like art, buildings, or machines.
Tips.example: They plan to restore the vintage car to its former glory.

Tips.title: Not Quick Fix
Tips.description: Restoration takes time and care, it's not a quick process.
Tips.example: The technicians will restore the old painting over several months.

Tips.title: Original Beauty
Tips.description: Focus is often on aesthetics; making something look as it once did.
Tips.example: The team worked hard to restore the mural's original beauty.

senses.de: To give back something lost or taken
senses.ex: He restored the lost wallet to its owner.

Tips.title: Lost and Found
Tips.description: Something lost or taken is returned willingly, often with a positive connotation.
Tips.example: The honest stranger restored my lost phone to me.

Tips.title: Rightful Owner
Tips.description: Emphasizing return of items or status to their legitimate owner or state.
Tips.example: The jewels were finally restored to the rightful owner after years.

senses.de: To put back into a former position or place
senses.ex: The queen was restored to the throne.

Tips.title: Historical Context
Tips.description: Often used in history or politics when talking about power or titles.
Tips.example: The exiled leader was restored to power after the revolution.

Tips.title: Status Regained
Tips.description: Used when someone or something gets back a lost status or condition.
Tips.example: After the scandal, the politician worked to restore her reputation.

senses.de: To refresh or rejuvenate after feeling tired or weak
senses.ex: A good night's sleep will restore your energy.

Tips.title: Health and Wellbeing
Tips.description: Commonly used when someone recovers their health or energy.
Tips.example: The spa weekend restored my sense of well-being.

Tips.title: Mental Refreshment
Tips.description: Also refers to mental or emotional states, not just physical.
Tips.example: A walk in nature can restore your peace of mind.

senses.de: To make active or bring into existence again
senses.ex: The government is working to restore the economy.

Tips.title: System Recovery
Tips.description: Often relates to economics or services being brought back to function.
Tips.example: Efforts are being made to restore electricity after the outage.

Tips.title: Revival Efforts
Tips.description: Focuses on bringing back activity or usage that had diminished or halted.
Tips.example: The city aims to restore the old train station to active use.

Establish.wordDefinition:
Establish means to create or start something new, while restore means to bring something back to its original state.

Establish is applicable when there is a need to make or create something new. For example, a new business might be established, or a new law might be established to deal with a particular problem.

Establish is about creating something new, while restore is about bringing something back to its original state.

Gain.wordDefinition:
Gain means to acquire, obtain or increase something that was not previously there. For example, you can gain muscle by exercising regularly or gain knowledge by reading books.

Gain is applicable when you want to obtain something new or increase what you already have, while restore is applicable when you want to bring back something to its previous state or condition.

Recover.wordDefinition:
Recover means to get back something that was lost or taken away. For example, you can recover from an illness, you can recover a stolen item, or you can recover from a financial loss.

Recover is applicable when something needs to be retrieved or regained, while restore is applicable when something needs to be returned to its original state or condition.

Reinstate.wordDefinition:
Reinstate means to bring something back to its previous position or state, especially after it has been temporarily removed or stopped.

This can refer to reinstating an employee in their job after being fired, or reinstating a rule or law that was previously canceled.

Reinstate is more focused on returning something to a previous position or condition, while restore is more focused on bringing something back to its original state.

Renew.wordDefinition:
Renew means to make something new or fresh again, like renewing a subscription or renewing a passport. It is applicable when something needs to be updated or restarted to its original state.

Renew means to make something new again while restore means to bring something back to its original state.

Repair.wordDefinition:
Repair means fixing something that is broken or damaged so that it can function properly again. For example, you might repair a hole in your shirt or a leaky faucet.

Repair is for fixing something that is currently not functioning, while restoration is for bringing something back to its original state or appearance.

Return.wordDefinition:
Return means to bring something back to the place where it came from. For example, if you borrow a book from a library, you must return it to the library.

The difference between the two words is that restore is used when something needs to be fixed or repaired to its former state, while return is used when something needs to be brought back to the place where it came from.

Revive.wordDefinition: Revive means to bring something back to life or to give it new energy or vitality. For example, reviving a dying plant means bringing it back to health by watering and nurturing it.

quotes.Text: As most of the population suffers through life, barely surviving, disappointed and confused day after day, hopeless, wondering what happened to their strong and beautiful country, it is in the media's power to restore, if not some of our quality of life, at least a bit of our peace of mind.
quotes.Title: American Musician
quotes.Name: Steven Van Zandt

quotes.Text: I got the idea that to write books would be the best way to spend a life. I never thought of anything else that seemed like half as much fun, although in my next life I would like to be an architect, too, so I can have an easier time restoring houses.
quotes.Title: American Educator
quotes.Name: Frances Mayes

quotes.Text: I arrange it by working four days away from home, and three days at home with the family, so I work four long days rather than five shorter. But it's hard because everything is on hold. We have to restore the family life during the weekends.
quotes.Title: Swedish Actress
quotes.Name: Sofia Helin

quotes.Text: The most important thing you will do is yet to be seen. For me, I found my important thing to do when I learned to do surgery on the eye, when I learned to restore a person's vision.
quotes.Title: American Politician
quotes.Name: Rand Paul

quotes.Text: Restoring a person's ability to achieve success when they leave the prison walls promotes public safety, builds our economy and, most importantly, is the right thing to do.
quotes.Title: American Lawyer
quotes.Name: Sally Yates

quotes.Text: Ethics reform is about restoring the public trust. When that is in doubt, nothing is more important than restoring it.
quotes.Title: American Politician
quotes.Name: Ken Cuccinelli

quotes.Text: True, permanent peace can never be restored, until slavery, the occasion of the war, has ceased.
quotes.Title: American Politician
quotes.Name: Gerrit Smith

quotes.Text: Canadians want to see real hope restored, not false hopes raised.
quotes.Title: Canadian Statesman
quotes.Name: Kim Campbell

quotes.Text: Restored' has been about how God has restored my life.
quotes.Title: American Musician
quotes.Name: Jeremy Camp

quotes.Text: I helped to restore America's leadership.
quotes.Title: American Politician
quotes.Name: Hillary Clinton
